    • Method Detail

      • getPropertyDescriptors

        public Map<String,Property> getPropertyDescriptors()
        Specified by:

      • getDefaultModel

        public Map<String,String> getDefaultModel()
        Description copied from interface: ModeledEmailTemplate
        An Map where JSON data can be stored. This allows both Stormpath and developers to define variables that can later be replaced when the template is being processed. For example, we currently store the linkBaseUrl key to hold the clickable url that the user will receive inside the reset password or verify account emails.
        Specified by:
        getDefaultModel in interface ModeledEmailTemplate
        Returns:
        the map where custom JSON data (like linkBaseUrl) can be stored.
        See Also:
        ModeledEmailTemplate.setLinkBaseUrl(String)

      • setLinkBaseUrl

        public ModeledEmailTemplate setLinkBaseUrl(String linkBaseUrl)
        Description copied from interface: ModeledEmailTemplate
        Convenience method to specify the clickable url that the user will receive inside the email. For example, in the reset password workflow, this url should point to the form where the user can insert his new password.

        This is just a convenience method and doing this: 

              modeledEmailTemplate.setLinkBaseUrl("http://mycompany.com/templateName.html");
        is equivalent to doing: 
             modeledEmailTemplate.getDefaultModel().put("linkBaseUrl", "http://mycompany.com/templateName.html");
        Specified by:
        setLinkBaseUrl in interface ModeledEmailTemplate
        Parameters:
        linkBaseUrl - clickable url where the user will be taken once he clicks on the URL received in the email.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getLinkBaseUrl

        public String getLinkBaseUrl()
        Description copied from interface: ModeledEmailTemplate
        Return the clickable url that the user will receive inside the email. This is just a convenience method and doing this: 
              String linkBaseUrl = modeledEmailTemplate.getLinkBaseUrl();
        is equivalent to doing: 
              String linkBaseUrl = modeledEmailTemplate.getDefaultModel().get("linkBaseUrl");
        Specified by:
        getLinkBaseUrl in interface ModeledEmailTemplate
        Returns:
        clickable url where the user will be taken once he clicks on the URL received in the email.
